title: Crystal’s river line promises lots of space and adventures
text:
Crystal’s river line promises lots of space and adventures 19 August 2015 Save 
Crystal Cruises has announced more details of its new river line, Crystal River Cruises, which will launch in Europe in late March 2017. 
The line said its two new river yacht vessels would feature “larger accommodations and space-to-guest ratio than any other river cruise ship”, with six-star service. 
It also promised a “fresh approach to traditional river itineraries and experiences”. 
The ships will feature 250 square-foot guest suites, with walk-in wardrobes, two 500 squarefoot penthouse suites, and a “palm court with dance floor and glassdomed roof”, as well as a fitness centre and spa. 
Meanwhile, destinations will include France, Germany, Switzerland, Holland, Belgium, Austria, Slovakia, Hungary, Croatia, Serbia, Romania and Bulgaria. 
There will also be some overnight stays, while for days spent in port, the line will offer its Crystal Adventures shore excursions, as well as its new programme, Active Exploration Adventures. 
The latter is tailored for “guests wanting a high-intensity shore-side activity”, with passengers able to create their own active adventures using the bicycles (electric or manual), Segways and other active gear available on the ship for independent exploration. 
A luxury yacht tender will also be on offer for private yachting experiences, which will take guests to more secluded areas within the destinations. 
“We continue to listen to what our guests and the luxury traveller want, and river cruises are what they’ve been telling us they want for some time - it’s a natural extension of the… ocean cruise Crystal has offered for the past 25 years,” said Crystal president and chief executive Edie Rodriguez. “Our guests will have the opportunity to revel in the unique environment that sets river cruising apart from other travel experiences.” 
Itineraries, fares and bookings for Crystal River Cruises will be available from December 1, 2015.
